Reviews.Title: “Good price for Bondi”
Reviews.Author: KellHazel
Reviews.Content: These rooms are great for a weekend away. I wouldn't exactly call them apartments though because they have kitchenettes and not kitchens. However why would you want to cook when there are so many restaurants in walking distance. Rooms were fairly modern, reovated quite cheap, but had aircon. Its about a 10 min walk to the beach, but at this price you can't expect more. Staff were really friendly. We had a lovely time in Bondi.

Reviews.Title: “Certainly Not Ultimate”
Reviews.Author: Helen L
Reviews.Content: Website was very misleading. The bedspread had white stains on it (!!), the sheets had holes, two light bulbs were not working, air con incredibly noisy and the security grill did not lock. I found the staff aloof. You can hear all the noise from the next door rooms. Room was not clean. Cleaners try moving the couch and also cleaning inside the wardrobe. Great location for what I wanted but oh dear! TV was small and in a bad location for viewing.

Reviews.Title: “The Ultimate in Disasters”
Reviews.Author: Bigkiwi
Reviews.Content: Ultimate Apartments Bondi Beach: As part of a six week trip around New Zealand and Australia we were attracted by the web site for this establishment. OK after four weeks on the road perhaps our expectations were raised by previous properties we had stayed at but surely isnâ€™t that the basis of all Trip Advisor assessments? The sign outside the property promises the best in Bondi but the experience inside those security gates is less than impressive. At Check In one is presented with a â€˜RENTAL AGREEMENT FORMâ€™. Now this form is a work of legal nonsense which one doesnâ€™t expect to have to sign for a four night stay; 48 separate items are listed under â€˜Liability for damageâ€™ from $990 for damage to the bed to $4 for a missing coat hanger, the one that really made me smile was $5 for the batteries in the TV remote control. As seasoned travellers we should have been smarter when we received the booking confirmation and read under â€˜Frequently asked Questionsâ€™ ARE WE A HOTEL OR A MOTEL? Answer â€œNo we do not provide on demand servicesâ€� Read that as this establishment provides no services at all repeat donâ€™t expect anything! $688 for four night is I believe a rate that entitles one to expect certain standards so let start with the obvious basic shortcomings and just to confirm my complaints check the photographs; cleanliness is sub standard â€“ anything above five feet hasnâ€™t been cleaned for ages which leads me to believe that is eye level of the cleaning staff. Tiles in the shower were a health hazard bathroom, cabinet top filthy, and the list could go on. The best of all was the sheets damage value $35 but as photographed had one hole and several areas where they were thread bare. Non serviced is another term taken to the extreme donâ€™t expect any complimentary tea, coffee or milk, towel changes are supposedly weekly but fortunately our visit didnâ€™t last long enough to put that to the test. The television is a joke and should be donated to the local science museum where it would be labelled as having belonged to Barney Rubble of Flintstone's fame. Outside I counted seven lights that were intended to illuminate the common walkway but required replacement and the same promlem persisted inside the unit where one bulb had burnt out. Whilst talking about lighting the switch for the lights above the bed was six foot above floor level requiring one to stand on the bed to switch the lights out last thing at night, a really romantic touch â€“ I Think Not! I urge fellow Trip Advisors to book elsewhere and avoid the disappointment we endured.

Reviews.Title: “Not "ultimate" but definitely decent and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: D M
Reviews.Content: When I read some of the reviews here, after I had booked and paid, I became very nervous. Those who liked the property seemed to really like it, but those with reservations seemed to really hate it. Ultimate apartments is a misnomer as the apartment units are basic, but for these prices you don't get a 4 or 5 star resort. The website clearly over represents the property, but we can't expect nirvana on a budget. My room was clean and comfortable, which is what I look for in a hotel. I didn't miss the daily maid service, which I see as wasteful and unnecessary whenever I travel. If you're expecting a first class resort you will be disappointed but if you want a clean, comfortable, reasonably priced base for exploring Bondi Beach, I think you will be satisfied with the Ultimate Apartments

Reviews.Title: “Great location but apartment was a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: traveller5759
Reviews.Content: The Ultimate Apartments are located close to Bondi Beach and in that sense they offer good value. However, while they offer budget level accommodation the furniture and fixtures in my view were very tired. The apartment I stayed in had a very lumpy bed and the lounge appeared stained and as a sofa bed it was substandard - very uncomfortable with a very thin mattress. The fact that a particle board plank had been added so that it could be used as a lounge gives you an idea of its well worn nature. The bathroom had dirt around the skirting boards and some tiles were cracked. Also no tea or coffee is provided and there is a single hotplate which was only to be used provided other appliances were not switched on. The apartment I stayed in, while it had air conditioning the air conditioner unit was very noisy. So the pluses are the location and provided your expectations are not great (and I accept that I took the words ultimate too literally) then the apartments offer good proximity to the beach and to restaurants, etc.

Reviews.Title: “....the apartments were very basic, but clean and the location was perfect for Bondi beach!!”
Reviews.Author: babyjedi
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days over the new year, our apartment was very basic but it was a perfect base for what we wanted. It is advertised as being contemporary apartments and their website was misleading. I was expecting more e.g. the bed was old and very uncomfortable. The location was perfect- Bondi beach only a five minute walk down the road, and Bondi junction shopping centre was only a bus ride away. it took us only 10-15 mins on the bus to get into the centre of Sydney with the bus being opposite the apartments. The room was clean and the staff were friendly, there was also a laundry room in the basement. Staff were also really helpful and supplied extra pillows etc when requested.

Reviews.Title: “Not good, but there's not much else around for the same price.”
Reviews.Author: Plow9
Reviews.Content: They claim "Not a hotel but better, the Ultimate Apartments is perfect for any type of stay. A a contemporary Bondi Beach property, offering quality apartment accommodation." What is actually true: converted motel rooms with the cheapest beds, linen, pillows etc that even charities would not accept. I'm not sure what they class as 'modern beds' but the bed in my room was the worst I had ever slept on - worse than sofa bed quality. The pillows were seriously an inch thick with no cushioning whatsoever. There was no foxtel in my room as they claim and most appliances were damaged. The bathroom drains were covered in old dirt and waste, but apart from that it wasn't what I would call 'dirty'. Just old and not cleaned professionally. I only stayed for one night thankfully, and next time I will shell out a few more bucks to actually get a good night's sleep. I paid $165 - which is a good rate for Sydney, but I expect better than one star motel quality for that price. A YMCA or hostel would be better. I recommend you pay a little more elsewhere and get value for your money. On the plus side, the staff were friendly and they provided a much needed heater because the antiquated air conditioning didn't do much other than make noise and leak water.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for budget travelers who want privacy”
Reviews.Author: terminate
Reviews.Content: I read less than complimentary reviews elsewhere and was a bit apprehensive about this place, but went for it anyway as we were on a budget and I wanted the ability to prepare my own food. It turned out to be fine. Sure, if you're expecting a luxury hotel, it isn't that. It's basically one room with comfortable bed(s) (we had a twin room), a sofa and table, a smallish TV, and a kitchen unit with utensils, cutlery and crockery. It has a kettle, a microwave and a single plug-in hob. It doesn't have a cooker, though, so you won't be fully self-catering. We made breakfast there, took sandwiches for lunch when I could be bothered to make them, and except for a couple of nights when I cooked meat pies and spuds, we ate dinner in restaurants. Those more adept/enthusiastic at cooking could do a lot more there, of course. We were there for 11 days. Towels are changed once a week. Half way through the week I just added them to our laundry. There's a laundry room in the basement with washers and dryers. No powder or change (though if you're lucky someone will have left powder). Cleaning is also done once a week. This isn't a hotel. It's 10 minutes from the beach, but we went in winter so our attention was on more cultural pursuits. Personally, I find the whole Bondi area pretty depressing, so apart from the first day when we walked to the beach and the second to last day when we did the Bondi-Clovelly walk (wonderful!!), we spent our time in the CIty. But that was convenient enough. The 389 bus stops right outside (both ways) and it's a half hour trip to Circular Quay. If you have to commute you'd probably get fed up with it, but on holiday it's part of the experience. You can buy daily or weekly prepaid tickets in the shop opposite the apartments (very friendly guy there! But avoid the Bondi Mini Supermarket up the road - the guy is as friendly as death). I would go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location but certainly not Ultimate”
Reviews.Author: SleepAdvisor
Reviews.Content: Behind the gates to the secure parking area reveals what was most likely a motel during the 70's. The land is probably earmarked for development and the owners are doing what is needed to keep it going, no more, no less. Make no mistakes, you are in a rental room and not a motel, lots and lots of signs telling you what you can and cant do, a list of prices should you break anything - 5 bucks for the plastic water filler for the iron?? Overall it was a pleasant enough place to stay, nice and secure albeit a little dated.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing, website is misleading”
Reviews.Author: Tangelic
Reviews.Content: The website describes the apartments as contemporary and quality - however, they have the feel of a cheap motel! The mattress on the bed was very thin and uncomfortable, and we had to sleep in our clothes to stay warm as there is only a thin blanket to keep covered. The heating unit could not heat the small apartment. I suppose that is why there was a little 10cmx20cm heater provided! The facilities are basic - no tea/coffee/sugar/milk supplies, no hair dryer, no additional blankets. While it advertises free foxtel, there are only three channels available. The location is not close the the beach as the description of "best on the beach" might suggest. While cheap, the lower rates are not good value.

Reviews.Title: “location was great but rooms were very dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: groucho046
Reviews.Content: The mattress on the bed was uncomfortable. there was no mattress protector or anything between it and the sheets. The sheets were clean. No coffee or tea sachets to help until able to get out and buy some-although there is a kitchenette-this was surprising. Advertises free foxtel-but only about 3 channels available. Reception only open for 5 hours per day. pool is clean however nothing comfortable to sit on around it.

Reviews.Title: “Not as advertised”
Reviews.Author: AliceSpringsJools
Reviews.Content: Ultimate Apartments are in fact partially renovated motel units. Ultimate Apartments boasts in it's advertising and on it's website that it's "best on beach". This is not true - in fact it's no where near the beach. It's approximately a 15 to 20 minute stroll away from the beach and there is absolutely no view of the beach from this accommodation. Don't be fooled into thinking that this is a serviced apartment as it boasts as well, servicing only occurs once a week. The aircondiditoning was poor and did not work very well, not to mention noisy! Do not count on being able to use the pull out sofa - the mattresses are so thin you can feel all of the bars and wires through the mattress - I ended up sleeping on the floor.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Bondi”
Reviews.Author: The_kosher_traveler
Reviews.Content: A series of mini-suites (on two levels) surround a gated courtyard with a small swimming pool at the center. Rooms contain all the usuals including various levels of cooking facilities (microwave to full kitchenette) and fridge. All furnishings are comfortable and in a decent state, but the over all feel is a little old fashioned in design. That said, it is comfortable and outstanding value in an expensive area. Pros: Good sized rooms (suites, really) excellent value in an expensive area. Cons: Furniture is a little old fashioned, front desk is only manned for limited hours

Reviews.Title: “Motorist Haven”
Reviews.Author: Doug&Sharon
Reviews.Content: If you are driving to Sydney and want to be near Bondi Beach then the Ultimate apartments give outstanding value with their secure gated free off street parking. Pedestrians might wish to be nearer than 700 meters to the beach but we had no problem with the walk and leaving the car safely parked by our unit. These are "serviced apartments" rather than a motel - but having your own light cooking facilities is a real plus unless you really want someone to clean your room and change your sheets every day.

Reviews.Title: “Best place you can stay in Bondi...”
Reviews.Author: BaileyForceThree
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of researching before booking a hotel in Bondi and believe me these are the best rates you're going to get in all of Sydney. We had a huuuuge family apartment which was well furnished with kitchenette, double bed, sofa bed and single bed. The sofa bed was a little uncomfortable but not so bad if you're short like me and can shuffle down. The room was clean, a little cold as it was winter, but well equipped with all the towels, blankets and amenities we needed. Only qualm was that the bathroom had a shower with a fixed head - not ideal for bathing a one year old baby.... The place is not a hotel though so don't expect room service, housekeeping and the like. They do have launderette facilities though and good facilities for BBQs. The pool looks a little sad but really, when you're ten minutes walk from Bondi you're hardly going to need it. Parking facilities were really good. We were in a camper that usually had trouble finding clearance in other hotel carparks but here we were fine. There were lots of places nearby to eat. Unfortunately, we did try Funky Pies and didn't have a very good experience there - but do try Sababa for the best falafel I've ever had, Moo! on the beachfront for great Aussie burgers (MUST TRY the Timtam milkshake - I still dream about it....) and Bondi Pizza, again by the waterfront. There are lots of great cafes nearby as well for brekkie and cheap eats. I recommend a morning doing brunch - lots of lovely places about for that. We loved Sugar Loaf @ Rose Bay. In all, I'd definitely stay here again. Accessible, simple, no frills accommodation at a good price for a family on the go.

Reviews.Title: “These apartments are the best value in Bondi Beach”
Reviews.Author: Joyce49
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here in 2009 and 2010. For the money we paid (Best to email the apartments for better deals) we found them to be the best value. There is nothing "cheap" in Bondi and these apartments have all you would need. Ask for one away from the tennis courts, as they start playing 7am in the morning. Pool was kept clean and we found it quiet on a night. I would recomend the Funky Pie shop in Glenayr Avenue for a lovely meal of pie, mash and peas for about $9 or $10. The cheapest meal in Bondi. Over the road of the apartments you can get a bus into Sydney every 10 mins or so and get dropped off right outside on the way back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the Price”
Reviews.Author: kfindlay1979
Reviews.Content: The Ultimate Apartments were the best value. The room was very clean, the bed was very comfortable and we appreciated having a kitchenette in the room. The location is fantastic! A quick 10 minute walk to the beach, and a quick 2 minute bus ride to Bondi Junction, giving you train access to the rest of Sydney. The Parking is free - which is a great advantage as the parking in Sydney is minimal and expensive. The rooms are air conditioned. The service was great. We had a clogged drain and they came and fixed it right away. Although there is no towel service, they always have fresh towels available that you can pick up at reception. Only criticism is that the wireless internet was not included.

Reviews.Title: “Good accommodation”
Reviews.Author: kinothai
Reviews.Content: It's a family run motel american style: u shape building with the swimming pool in the middle of the courtyard / parking. The rooms are provided with a small kitchenette and living area. Bathroom is really basic and needs a deep renovation. Cleanliness might be improved ... The man at the front office - probably the owner - is really very kind and polite. Bondi beach is only 5 minutes walking and in the area there is a number of restaurants and cafes.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, pity about the beds”
Reviews.Author: auckwood
Reviews.Content: Shared an apartment (well more like a large room with bathroom and mini kitchen) with my two adult daughters for three nights. The location was fantastic - bus stop across the road, $2 trip to Bondi Junction. Beach 10 minutes away and just a short walk to Bondi Cafe which does a great breakfast and really good coffee. The pool, which is in the middle of the car park, was clean and was a real bonus as the weather was so hot. Not a great pool for lounging around though, there is shade but not a lot of "pretty". However, our room was nice and clean, the shower really good, microwave, hot plate, plates etc. BUT, the twin beds had mattresses which were vinyl, (like you might get at a school camp) and with the sheet straight on top, the sheet wriggled about all night and we felt quite sweaty - there was no undersheet. The pull out sofa was nice to sit on, but when made into a bed it was a torture machine!! Very, very thin mattress and the wires and bars poked up made it very uncomfortable. We piled the bedspreads from the other beds on top of the mattress to try and make it a bit softer. We did manage to sleep ok, but only because we were exhausted from so much walking and shopping!!! So yes, an excellent location, but comes with a bed warning!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we needed”
Reviews.Author: sparkleytraveler
Reviews.Content: I brought my American boyfriend to Sydney for the first time and wanted to make sure we stayed right by Bondi Beach. Ultimate Apartments is ideally located, a 7min walk to the beach, close to great restaurants and cafes and not far from the city or other gorgeous parts of the eastern suburbs. Ultimate Apartments was clean, simple and inexpensive. We were there to hit the beach and take in the sights of Sydney, not to sit in a fancy hotel room. Don't get me wrong, I love the finer things in life but for our purposes? This was exactly what we needed. I would definitely recommend it to other people and in fact, I already have!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Mistyandray
Reviews.Content: I was very nervous about staying at the ultimate appartments after reading negative feedback before leaving on our holiday.. My opinion is ignore the negative feedback and find out for yourselves. What I did find was a great "budget" place to stay in an excellant location. The rooms were clean and very quiet for such a busy area and the staff were very friendly. There was a bus stop right outside the appartments which takes you to Bondi Junction where you can shop to your hearts content. or hop on another bus or train to go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very disapointed”
Reviews.Author: Codiegirl
Reviews.Content: The web page gives you a totally wrong impression of what the place is and its location ie best on the beach ( not even close), apartments . This is a Motel type set up with no end of rules and regulations stuck all over the place , makes you feel nervous about doing or touching anything .Its all very uninviting and extremely disappointing .I was glad I wasn't staying any longer than two nights .The unit was very clean and well presented and the bed very comfortable but that's about all it had going for it .

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: citygirlontravels
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while visiting family whom live in Bondi. At the time the management couple were very approachable and very willing to please. The rooms are basic ,, but the location was excellent. The bus Stop is directly out side the front enterence which will bring you to Bondi junction. There are shops and lovely cafes 3 minutes walk away. The best seafood restaurant in 4 mins of a walk and best of all Bondi Beach is at the bottom of the street. Pool area is secure and we will def be back

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: colcol
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 2 weeks and hated it. on the first night there a huge cockroach ran from under the fridge. from then on we sprayed the room with cockroach kiiler every time we left the room. the lighting is dreadful; far too bright and all lights controlled by one switch. the furniture is old and uncomfortable. the settee faces the sink, fridge and cooking area. the TV is small. the bathroom is basic. the price was high for what was provided. we booked this room on the basis of its location and that was the only good point. never again.

Reviews.Title: “IGNORE THE 2 POOR REVIEWS”
Reviews.Author: touseclc
Reviews.Content: I had already booked these apartments before the 2 poor reviews were posted so was a little aprehensive about what it would be like but it was fine. There is nothing fancy about the rooms but I went out of season and paid a very reasonable rate and you get what you pay for. As earlier reviews have said this is basic clean accommodation in a very good location. It was very good value for money. In a resort like this all you are doing is sleeping and showering in the room and it was absolutely fine for that. I would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous Disappointment! Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: b416
Reviews.Content: Tremendous disappointment. Do not stay here! These are not in fact 'apartments'; this is an old, grungy, converted motel. Feels like this should be a $59/night room. The rooms are not very nice - it's like staying at someone's house with crappy furniture. Our room had an air conditioner that was so loud, it was impossible to sleep without ear plugs. You also couldn't change the settings on the A/C because the buttons were broken, so you were stuck in leaving it 'on' maximum all the time, which meant freezing at night. Bathroom is of poor quality and feels dirty. Kitchenette is a nice bonus, but our fridge had a foul odour to it that we couldn't get rid of. Don't forget to bring your own SHAMPOO and CONDITIONER - it's not provided! And pack a bar of soap, you'll only be given a tiny bar good for washing your hands. There is no daily cleaning service, or towel/sheet change. They only do this once per week. They wouldn't even exchange our towels at reception after a few days because they "aren't a hotel". The location is alright - it's about a 10 minute walk to Bondi Beach. There is a bus stop right out front, which takes you to Bondi Junction (mall + subway station), so that's the only convenient part. Also, laundry facilities downstairs. There is reliable wireless Internet access on the property ($50/week) if you brought your laptop. The hotel pool is right in the middle of the parking lot, with cars on either side. Their web site leads you to believe this is a NEW property (2005) - perhaps its under NEW ownership - there's nothing new about this place. The photos on their web site musty have been retouched in Photoshop to make them look half decent. The furniture seems like it was bought from students moving out of their temporary housing at the end of the school year. I chose this hotel because it's the only one I could find online near Bondi (except the Swiss Grand (?) which was really expensive). I would definately not stay here again - I would rather stay downtown (like at the Meriton Kent St. - same price, world of difference) and have to take transit to go to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, basic accommodation in a great location”
Reviews.Author: k8mol
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner booked this accommodation the morning of our arrival. Upon arrival we were greeted at reception by friendly staff. The apartments are very basic but kept clean. The main plus is the location of these apartments. Just a 5 minute stroll by lots a little cafes and shops and you're at Bondi Beach. (lovely sand and blue sea). The pool isnt the best but good enough for a quick dip to refresh after sunbathing on the deck as some people seemed to do but with the beautiful beach moments away I much preferred to spend my time there. Tip - try the wedges with sour cream and sweet chilli sauce (more than enough for 2 people as a snack) from the Bondi Beach hotel. Lovely. Also eat out at Hurricanes which is mad busy at night so be prepared for a wait if you dont book but its great for steaks and ribs.

Reviews.Title: “Safe and Satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: EPD
Reviews.Content: I stayed one week at these apartments at the end of October 07 when I was out in Sydney visiting my son and daughter in law. The location is excellent as everyone has said. The bus stops right outside for Bondi Junction or Sydney centre. It is a 5 minute walk to cafes and shops (although there is a convenience store across the road) and it was a very safe area. The studio I had (number 11) was perfectly satisfactory, it was clean and had everything I needed. The bathroom was excellent - although I would have appreciated a towel change sometime during the week. The bed was comfortable and although the sheets/bedding was clean - some of it was frayed and a bit torn. Security is pretty good and no-one can wander in to the complex unless they are admitted by guests. The pool was a bit odd being in the middle of the car park but it was a pleasure to swim in. The people on the front desk were pleasant and helpful. Downside: well at night some people made a lot of noise and were crashing around up and down the stairs which was a bit irritating. With no concierge on the premises at night there is no-one to complain to and I certainly wasn't going to go out on my own and tackle the people at 3 or 4 am. At the rear of my apartment was a tennis club - which started playing about 6.30am some days! My main gripe is the large window with the vertical blinds. People passing by CAN see in if the light is on. This is because there is a gap and with the wardrobe doors being mirrors as you walk towards the studios you can actually see in the entire studio as it reflects. I was not happy about this and it needs sorting. I was otherwise quite happy in my studio but might have preferred to stay at the large hotel on the seafront if I had a bit more cash, it looked very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Basic accommodations good value”
Reviews.Author: loPDXer
Reviews.Content: Our experience at Ultimate was much as described in the reviews here. The accommodations are clean and basic. One appeal of Ultimate is its central location in Bondi Beach - five minutes from the beach, nestled close to cafes, shops and fooderies plus the bus stop is directly on O'Brien out front of the property. The furnishings are adequate - heat and AC are hit or miss but plenty of hot water. One caution is the staff is minimal and hard to find and facility is completely dark after midnight - stumbly dangerous at night in fact with not so much as a nightlight left burning to lite the way of early risers. In this price range and location, this is great value despite the shortcomings for basic, comfortable, accommodations. Reasonably quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price, but don't expect a lot”
Reviews.Author: te_amo1
Reviews.Content: There was a small ant problem in my room around the countertop. The screen doors didn't have a stopper so they always slammed and made a lot of noise, and closed on our luggage or heels. Don't get this confused as a hotel, you will have to wash the two towels they give you and your own sheets, blankets, etc. in the room downstairs. There are no amenities such as soap but a tiny bar by the sink. ***There is NOBODY at the desk after like 5pm! Some guy just arrived at 6pm and had no call back on the number listed on the door, so he was stranded and couldn't get a room that he booked. Also, it's a gated/locked premise so he couldn't even get in. TERRIBLE! *** They also leave your mail outside the lobby door for anybody who stays there to look at and maybe take. !! Other than that, it was a FANTASTIC location just down the street from Bondi Beach. We loved the cafe areas. The rooms were simple and neat, no complaints about that. They came stocked with dishes, plates, etc. The staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great loaction!”
Reviews.Author: BPaton
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few nights in March and I have to say it is a GREAT location! Bus stop right outside which takes you right into Sydney city centre and Bondi Beach a 5 min walk down the road with great cafes and bars on the way. The lady that runs the apartments is super friendly and helpful and really made us feel welcome. The apartments were bigger than we thought they would be - have everything you need and yes are basic but were perfect for what we needed. My only complaint is the blinds for the big window facing the hallway - so not anything to be worried about! I wholeheartedly would recommend this as somewhere to stay if you are not keen on forking out the big bucks and want to stay somewhere nice!

Reviews.Title: “Basic accomm but perfect for our needs”
Reviews.Author: janjow
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 29th Dec to 6th Jan so over New Year. Paid $150 a night as it was a peak time. Rooms very basic but fine. good to be by the beach as weather was warm and lots of sun too (even though they had forecast rain!). bus stop right outside to go to bondi junction train station or directly into the city,. we caught the bus a lot. very frequent - never had to wait long.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: paddygirl04
Reviews.Content: Nice apartments, wouldnt put anymore than 2 people in one though. Apartments were clean and furnished with everything needed for a self catering stay. Only 10min walk from Bondi Beach and 20 mins bus ride from Sydney city centre and bus stop is right outside apartment complex.. Be warned though, the pool is nothing like it looks on the apartment's website, its absolutely tiny and in the middle of the car park (literally). Overall though, was good value for money and would recommend them to anyone. Maybe not for those looking for that something special though.

HotelInfo.Name: Ultimate Apartments Bondi Beach
HotelInfo.Address: 59 O'Brien St | Bondi Beach, Sydney, New South Wales 2026, Australia
